meanings.definition: A person who makes a stipulation or condition.
meanings.sent1: The stipulators in the contract insisted on a specific deadline for completion.
meanings.sent2: The stipulators at the negotiation table were firm about their demands.
meanings.sent3: The stipulators at the party only wanted to play games with strict rules.
meanings.sent4: Her parents were the stipulators of her curfew, always setting it at 10 pm sharp.
meanings.sent5: The stipulators of the treasure hunt left clues in hidden locations around the park.

meanings.definition: A group or organization that sets forth terms or conditions.
meanings.sent1: The stipulators of the rental agreement required a security deposit.
meanings.sent2: The stipulators in the company's policy department ensure compliance with regulations.
meanings.sent3: The stipulators of the school rules met to discuss new guidelines for students.
meanings.sent4: The stipulators of the trade deal carefully outlined the terms of the agreement.
meanings.sent5: The stipulators of the competition announced the rules to all participants.
